TestDescription.name: Spring Boot Actuator
TestDescription.Description: Actuator endpoints allow you to monitor and interact with your Spring application. Spring Boot includes a number of built-in endpoints and you can also add your own. For example the health endpoint provides basic application health information. The following endpoints are available: [break] [ul] [li][bold]/autoconfig[/bold] - Displays an auto-configuration report showing all auto-configuration candidates and the reason why they 'were' or 'were not' applied.[/li] [li][bold]/beans[/bold] - Displays a complete list of all the Spring beans in your application.[/li] [li][bold]/configprops[/bold] - Displays a collated list of all @ConfigurationProperties.[/li] [li][bold]/dump[/bold] - Performs a thread dump.[/li] [li][bold]/env[/bold] - Exposes properties from Spring's ConfigurableEnvironment.[/li] [li][bold]/health[/bold] - Shows application health information (a simple 'status' when accessed over an unauthenticated connection or full message details when authenticated).[/li] [li][bold]/info[/bold] - Displays arbitrary application info.[/li] [li][bold]/metrics[/bold] - Shows 'metrics' information for the current application.[/li] [li][bold]/mappings[/bold] - Displays a collated list of all @RequestMapping paths.[/li] [li][bold]/shutdown[/bold] - Allows the application to be gracefully shutdown (not enabled by default).[/li] [li][bold]/trace[/bold] - Displays trace information (by default the last few HTTP requests).[/li] [/ul]
TestDescription.Impact: These endpoints may leak sensitive information to a potential attacker. An attacker can use this information to conduct further attacks.
TestDescription.Recommendation: In production is recommended to disable access to these endpoints.
